p: Genome admixture in China and in South America is also visible when the sampled genomes are projected together in a PCA space defined by original subtypes i.e., which originate from the beginning of the HIV epidemic in Africa ( Figure 3, E and F and K and L). Several HIV-1 genomes are present on the straight edges of the triangles defined by the ones at the origin. Temporal PCA patterns also suggest homogenization between subtypes B and C in China and between B and F1 in South America, as they move away from the pure subtypes in PCA space.
